alert.note: Alert for Graham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 2:33AM EDT until August 15 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Graham County in western North Carolina... * Until 830 AM EDT. * At 233 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Areas near Snowbird Creek, Long Branch, and other streams and inlets on the south side of Lake Santeetlah will experience flash flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Robbinsville and Lake Santeetlah. Additionally, low spots near Atoah Road, Little Snowbird Road, and Long Creek Road may experience sudden bouts of dangerous flash flooding as rainfall rates pick up and nearby streams overflow. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
